0.title: Public APIs
0.content: At this time, we do not yet offer any public APIs for developers. Please continue to check this page for updates.

2.title: Our Apps
2.content: Source code for our mobile app for iOS and Android is available on Github: . | https://github.com/hebrewbooks/mobile_app_public | .

4.title: Table of Contents
4.content: . | Book Content . | Book Structure | Book Metadata | Book Viewers | . | Constructing Links . | Linking to Book Information Pages | Linking to Book Thumbnails | Linking to a Specific Page Number | . | .

5.title: Book Content
5.content: Book Structure . The main and beta site both primarily host scans of books in PDF and image formats. The primary identity for any given book is a six digit number ranging between 1 and 999,999, known as the “book ID”. Each book consists of a number of pages, identified by a four digit number ranging from 1 to 9,999. These should NOT include leading zeroes. Some books may include additional structural elements such as categories and tables of content, but these are not yet available to developers. Book Metadata . Each book has a number of metadata fields such as title, author, year of publication, page count, etc. These are displayed on the main book information page for each book and some are searchable via search forms on our sites. Book Viewers . Both sites offer users ability to view books page by page, or to download the entire book as a PDF. While both sites offer a PDF-based viewer for page by page turning, the beta site also has an experimental image-based viewer that allows faster browsing through the book.

6.title: Constructing Links
6.content: When constructing links to our content, please be aware of the following: . | Do not add additional parameters | Do not pad book IDs or page numbers with leading zeros | Do not link directly to the PDFs or images of the books or their pages | . Linking to Book Information Pages . Each book has a primary information page which includes the thumbnail of the title page and the book metadata. The canonical way to link to an information page for a given book is a follows: . | Main site: https://www.hebrewbooks.org/XXXXXX where XXXXXX is the book ID | Beta site: https://beta.hebrewbooks.org/XXXXXX where XXXXXX is the book ID | . Examples of valid links: . | https://hebrewbooks.org/1 | https://beta.hebrewbooks.org/6788 | https://hebrewbooks.org/45463 | . Linking to Book Thumbnails . On the book information page, there is an thumbnail of the title page. The canonical way to link to thumbnail of a given book is a follows: . | Main site: https://hebrewbooks.org/thumbs/XXXXXX.png where XXXXXX is the book ID | Beta site: use the same link as the main site | . Examples of valid links to thumbnails: . | https://hebrewbooks.org/thumbs/1.png | https://hebrewbooks.org/thumbs/6788.png | https://hebrewbooks.org/thumbs/45463.png | . Linking to a Specific Page Number . It is possible to link to a specific page number which will then open the book to that page in the book viewer. To canonical way to construct page viewer links is as follows: . | Main site: https://hebrewbooks.org/pdfpager.aspx?req=XXXXX&pgnum=YYYY where XXXXXX is the book ID and YYYY is the page number | Beta site (PDF viewer): https://beta.hebrewbooks.org/pdfpager.aspx?req=XXXXX&pgnum=YYYY where XXXXXX is the book ID and YYYY is the page number | Beta site (experimental image viewer): https://beta.hebrewbooks.org/reader/reader.aspx?sfid=XXXXX#p=YYYY where XXXXXX is the book ID and YYYY is the page number | . Examples of valid links to specific page numbers in the viewer: . | https://hebrewbooks.org/pdfpager.aspx?req=1&pgnum=10 | https://beta.hebrewbooks.org/pdfpager.aspx?req=1&pgnum=10 | https://beta.hebrewbooks.org/reader/reader.aspx?sfid=6788#p=36 | .

8.title: Changelog
8.content: Noteable changes will be documented in this file . 2026-01-13 . | Initial commits | .

9.title: Data and Metadata
9.content: Some of our metadata is available for libraries as described below. At this time, we do not yet offer any other data, metadata or content for developers. Please continue to check this page for updates.

11.title: Feedback
11.content: To provide feedback, either open a new issue in our documentation repository at GitHub or send feedback via this form. You can also email us at developers@hebrewbooks.org.

12.title: Developer Documentation for HebrewBooks.org
12.content: HebrewBooks.org was founded in order to preserve old American Hebrew books that are out of print and/or circulation. Currently our mission has expanded to include all Torah books ever written. On this site, you will find technical documentation targeting developers that want to interact with content provided by HebrewBooks.org. This is very much a work in progress and is subject to change.

15.title: MARC Records for Libraries
15.content: We do not provide MARC records to libraries directly. However, most HebrewBooks.org titles have been uploaded into WorldCat under the institution code NYHBW and should be available in OCLC WorldCat or the National Library of Israel (NLI). You can also view most of our titles via the WorldCat website.

16.title: OAI-PMH Gateway
16.content: We operate an OAI-PMH gateway for use by libraries and archives. Please contact us at oai@hebrewbooks.org for more information. The metadata in WorldCat and our OAI-PMH gateway is updated on a less frequent basis than our websites. If you run into problems, please reach out and let us know.

17.title: Linking to Our Content
17.content: In this section you will find information about how various sites, how content is structured within those sites and the right ways to link users to that content. Please be aware that you MAY NOT embed our content into any other sites or apps via mechanisms such as webview or iframe.

18.title: Table of Contents
18.content: . | Linking to Other Content . | Types of Content | How to Link to the Babylonian Talmud / Shas . | List of valid values | . | . | .

19.title: Linking to Other Content
19.content: This page describes how to link to other content we offer .

20.title: Types of Content
20.content: Besides book scans, we also offer several specialized types of content as follows: . | Main site (hebrewbooks.org) and Beta Site (beta.hebrewbooks.org): . | Text version of the Friedberg Rambam and commentaries (https://hebrewbooks.org/rambam) | Scans/Text of the Babylonian Talmud (Shas) and links to related commentaries (https://hebrewbooks.org/shas) | . | Beta site only (beta.hebrewbooks.org): . | Scanned version of the Rambam (https://beta.hebrewbooks.org/rambam) | Scans of the Arba Turim / Tur and Shulchan Aruch (https://beta.hebrewbooks.org/tursa) | . | Manuscripts site (hebrewmanuscripts.org): . | Scans of manuscripts | . | . At this time, we only offer a way to link to the Talmud as described below.

21.title: How to Link to the Babylonian Talmud / Shas
21.content: The canonical way to construct the links is af follows: . | https://hebrewbooks.org/shas.aspx?mesechta=XX&daf=YYY&format=pdf | https://beta.hebrewbooks.org/shas.aspx?mesechta=XX&daf=YYY&format=pdf | . The parameters are as follows - all without leading zeroes: . | XX - is two digit mesechta / tractate number from the table below | YYY - is a three digit page number. Page numbers may include a side: . | YYY - is YYY, side a (do not include a in the parameter) | YYYb - is YYY, side b | . | Z is the format which can be one of the following values: . | pdf - PDF images | text - text only | . | . The links will lead to the page itself, we do not yet offer a way to link to the related commentaries or calendars. Example links: . | Yomah 2b - PDF: https://beta.hebrewbooks.org/shas.aspx?mesechta=6&daf=2b&format=pdf | Gitin 46a - TEXT: https://hebrewbooks.org/shas.aspx?mesechta=19&daf=46&format=text | . List of valid values . | Value | Mesechta | Page Numbers Range | . | 1 | Berachos | 2 - 64 | . | 2 | Shabbos | 2 - 157b | . | 3 | Eruvin | 2 - 105 | . | 4 | Pesachim | 2 - 121b | . | 5 | Shekalim | 2 - 22b | . | 6 | Yomah | 2 - 88 | . | 7 | Succah | 2 - 56b | . | 8 | Beitzah | 2 - 40b | . | 9 | Rosh Hashana | 2 - 35 | . | 10 | Taanis | 2 - 31 | . | 11 | Megillah | 2 - 32 | . | 12 | Moed Katan | 2 - 29 | . | 13 | Chagigah | 2 - 27 | . | 14 | Yevamos | 2 - 122 | . | 15 | Kesubos | 2 - 112b | . | 16 | Nedarim | 2 - 91b | . | 17 | Nozir | 2 - 66b | . | 18 | Sotah | 2 - 49b | . | 19 | Gittin | 2 - 90 | . | 20 | Kiddushin | 2 - 82b | . | 21 | Baba Kama | 2 - 119b | . | 22 | Baba Metzia | 2 - 119 | . | 23 | Baba Basra | 2 - 176b | . | 24 | Sanhedrin | 2 - 113b | . | 25 | Makos | 2 - 24b | . | 26 | Shevuos | 2 - 49b | . | 27 | Avoda Zarah | 2 - 76b | . | 28 | Horayos | 2 - 14 | . | 29 | Zevachim | 2 - 120b | . | 30 | Menachos | 2 - 110 | . | 31 | Chulin | 2 - 142 | . | 32 | Bechoros | 2 - 61 | . | 33 | Erchin | 2 - 34 | . | 34 | Temura | 2 - 34 | . | 35 | Kerisus | 2 - 28b | . | 36 | Meilah | 2 - 22 | . | 37 | Niddah | 2 - 73 | .

22.title: Our Sites
22.content: We operate a number of sites. Our main sites are: . | HebrewBooks.org - main site containing scans of printed books and other content . | URLs include “hebrewbooks.org” and “www.hebrewbooks.org” | . | Beta.HebrewBooks.org - beta site with experimental features, similar to the main site. | URL for this site is “beta.hebrewbooks.org” | . | . We also host a site for scanned manuscripts (HebrewManuscripts.org) but do not yet offer a way to link to specific items there. While there may exist other sites operated by us, developers should only use the link to the sites listed above.

23.title: Terms of Use
23.content: Our content, code, name, logo and other intellectual property are subject to terms of use. We ask that all developers follow and respect these terms in order to ensure that our sites remain available freely for all users.
